original: Can I get you anything else?
translated: Puis-je vous procurer quoi que ce soit d'autre ?

original: Many of the world's seven thousand or so languages are spoken only by handfuls of living people and are in danger of extinction.
translated: Beaucoup des environ sept mille langues du monde ne sont parlées que par quelques poignées de personnes vivantes et sont menacées d'extinction.

original: The buds began to burst.
translated: Les bourgeons ont commencé à s'ouvrir.

original: How often do you shave?

original: She acted in the play.

original: I'd like to call my parents.

original: Your CV is littered with spelling mistakes.

original: This book belongs to the library.

original: We saw monkeys at the zoo.

original: She's very interested in music.

original: The road runs along the river.

original: We'll settle on that.

original: "This conversation has never occurred." "What conversation?"
translated: « Cette conversation n'a jamais eu lieu. » « Quelle conversation ? »

original: I'm a little bit tired.
translated: Je suis un peu fatigué.

original: Go ahead.
translated: Continue !

original: Why don't you stick around for a few minutes?
translated: Pourquoi ne restes-tu pas quelques minutes ?

original: They're kidding.

original: I would think you have other things to keep you busy.
translated: J'imagine que d'autres choses te tiennent occupée.

original: It's impossible to fix.
translated: Il est impossible de le réparer.

original: Our refrigerator is out of order.
translated: Notre réfrigérateur est en panne.

original: They limped.

original: Her daughter has what it takes to be a good teacher.

original: That girl looks like Mary.

original: Read books that interest you.

original: "The economy has opened up a faultline in the Atlantic," announces La Stampa, reporting on the impact of recent remarks by Barack Obama which imply that the poor management of the Eurozone crisis is to blame for the feeble outlook for growth in the US.
translated: “L’économie éloigne les deux rives de l’Atlantique”, La Stampa résume ainsi les conséquences des récentes déclarations de Barack Obama, selon lesquelles les maigres perspectives de croissance des États-Unis sont dues à la mauvaise gestion de la crise de la zone euro.

original: Take off your jacket and empty your pockets.
translated: Enlevez votre veste et videz vos poches.

original: Nevertheless, he found time for a short meeting.
translated: Néanmoins, il a trouvé du temps pour une courte entrevue.

original: I owe him a debt.

original: Are you sure you can handle this?

original: I immediately knew what it was.

original: The dove is a famous symbol for peace.
translated: La colombe est un symbole de paix célèbre.

original: Generally speaking, men can run faster than women can.
translated: D'une façon générale, les hommes peuvent courir plus vite que les femmes.

original: Tom broke up with me.

original: In the post office, mail is classified according to the place where it is to go.
translated: À la poste, le courrier est classé selon sa destination.

original: We wonder why.

original: You'll find many bargains there.
translated: Vous y trouverez de nombreuses bonnes affaires.

original: Now that you're grown up, you must not behave like that.

original: A tsunami is coming, so please be on the alert.
translated: Un tsunami approche, alors soyez sur vos gardes.

original: They can't see me.

original: Am I a cat?

translated: Il a été battu avec une barre métallique lors d'un match de football violent.

original: After all his efforts, he also failed this time.

original: Sami has a ride.

original: It was a fine day and there were no clouds in the sky.
translated: C'était une belle journée et il n'y avait pas de nuages dans le ciel.

original: Welcome to Brazil!

original: Like mother, like daughter.

original: Thanks for last night.

original: The city is full of tourists.

original: I feel kind of nauseous.

original: You're all cowards.

original: She looks like her aunt.

translated: John Wayne était une des stars de cinéma les plus populaires de ce siècle.

original: You're lost.

original: I'm glad to see you in one piece.

original: Is this a date?

original: Women love presents.

original: If someone wants the ceremony to be held in accordance with Japanese Shinto ritual, then that is possible at this church.
translated: Si quelqu'un veut que la cérémonie se déroule selon le rituel du Shinto japonais, c'est possible à cette église.

original: He talks about her too much.
translated: Il parle trop d'elle.

original: I don't have any money.
translated: Je n'ai pas d'argent.

original: No mountain in Japan is higher than Mt. Fuji.
translated: Aucune montagne au Japon n'est plus grande que le Mont Fuji.

original: They did a tour of the world!

original: Here everything is as it was during her lifetime.

original: Balls!

translated: Le règne de Louis XIV a duré soixante-douze ans.

original: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
translated: Le monde est comme un livre, et ceux qui ne voyagent pas n'en lisent qu'une seule page.

original: Could you check the tire pressure?

original: I dove into the river.

original: I'm a married woman now.

original: A ship which conveys oil is called an oil tanker.
translated: Un bateau qui transporte du pétrole est appelé un tanker.

original: Open the door, please.

original: I like this answer.

original: Let me repair it.

original: Society is complex.

original: He'll have to do this task again.

original: The police have few clues to go on in this case.

original: He's sketching an apple.

original: You limped.

original: You don't need to wait.

original: They prefer a window seat.

original: The ground was covered with leaves.

original: Do you want me to paint you?

original: Too bitter.

original: The boy is very honest.

original: I was terribly frightened.

original: Tom never trusted Mary.

original: Is that too expensive for you?

original: They are reading books in the library.

original: He talked with his eyes shining.

translated: Tom a pris une douche avant le petit-déjeuner.

translated: Je pense qu'il va bientôt pleuvoir.

original: He's a freshman.
translated: C'est un bleu.

original: He has a headache.
translated: Il a mal à la tête.

original: It is difficult to keep up a conversation with someone who only says "yes" and "no".
translated: Il est difficile d'entretenir une conversation avec quelqu'un qui ne dit que « oui » et « non ».

original: How do you live like this?
translated: Comment vivre ainsi ?

original: If it is fine tomorrow, we'll go on a picnic.
translated: Si demain le temps est beau, nous irons pique-niquer.

original: That matter is still unresolved.
translated: Cette question n’est toujours pas résolue.

original: Now is the winter of our discontent.
translated: C'est maintenant qu'est l'hiver de notre mécontentement.

original: Do you remember anything else?
translated: Vous souvenez-vous de quoi que ce soit d'autre ?

original: Here lives one bear.
translated: Un ours vit ici.

original: Can you tell us more about it?
translated: Pouvez-vous nous en dire plus ?

original: We learned French.
translated: Nous avons appris le français.

original: I never should've left you.
translated: Je n'aurais jamais dû te quitter.

original: Have they responded?
translated: Ont-elles réagi ?

original: You may take the book.
translated: Vous pouvez prendre le livre.

original: I was kept waiting nearly half an hour.
translated: On me fit attendre presque une demi-heure.

original: Tom wasn't at all surprised.
translated: Tom était loin d'être surpris.

original: There was no one left but me.
translated: Il n'y avait plus personne sauf moi.

original: How do you eat a panini that was once a pizza?
translated: Comment mange-t-on un panini qui était autrefois une pizza ?

original: They're hiding in the woods.
translated: Ils se cachent dans les bois.

original: Can you show me?
translated: Peux-tu me montrer ?

original: Please stop playing with your hat.
translated: Arrête de jouer avec ton chapeau, s'il te plaît.

original: He's older, but no wiser.
translated: Il est plus vieux, mais pas plus sage.

original: Don't believe everything people tell you.
translated: Ne crois pas à tout ce que les gens te disent.

original: Maybe it's true.
translated: Peut-être est-ce la vérité.

original: You will succeed in learning English.
translated: Vous arriverez à apprendre l'anglais.

original: They were tortured.
translated: Ils ont été torturés.

original: You don't look well.
translated: Tu n'as pas l'air bien.

original: The man wears glasses.
translated: L'homme porte des lunettes.

original: Hurry up.
translated: Magnez-vous !

original: I will be able to marry her.
translated: Je pourrai me marier avec elle.

original: I have high blood pressure.
translated: J'ai de l'hypertension.

original: Don't even joke about that.
translated: Ne plaisante même pas à ce sujet !

original: Where exactly did you go?
translated: Où êtes-vous allée, exactement ?

original: Can you answer this riddle?
translated: Sais-tu résoudre cette énigme ?

original: I don't wish that on anyone.
translated: Je ne le souhaite à personne.

original: Are you children all right?
translated: Vos enfants vont-ils bien ?

original: You guys are weird.
translated: Vous êtes bizarre les gars.

original: Let's not ever try doing that again.
translated: N'essayons plus jamais de faire ça.

original: He represented his class at the meeting.
translated: Il représentait sa classe à la réunion.

original: I have some correspondence to deal with.
translated: J'ai du courrier à traiter.

original: I'll call you when I arrive in Boston.
translated: Je t'appellerai quand j'arriverai à Boston.

original: The cat is sleeping.
translated: La chatte dort.

original: I am afraid of having trouble.
translated: J'ai peur d'avoir des problèmes.

original: I'll work as long as I live.
translated: Je travaillerai aussi longtemps que je vivrai.

original: My brother's son is my nephew.
translated: Le fils de mon frère est mon neveu.

original: I only wish that were possible.
translated: Je souhaiterais seulement que ce soit possible.

original: I have been selling books for twenty years.
translated: Cela fait 20 ans que je vends des livres.

original: This looks kind of cute.
translated: Ça a l'air assez mignon.

original: Have you studied Darwin's theory of evolution?
translated: Avez-vous étudié la théorie de l'évolution de Darwin ?

original: Wear warm clothes or you could get sick.
translated: Portez des vêtements chauds ou vous risquez une maladie.

original: That's a cheap cop-out.
translated: C'est une excuse à deux balles.

original: Some systems, such as Burroughs B5500, do not use paging to implement virtual memory. Instead, they use segmentation, that divide virtual address spaces into variable-length segments. A virtual address consists of a segment number and an offset within the segment.
translated: Certains systèmes, comme le Burroughs B5500, n'utilisent pas la pagination pour mettre en œuvre la mémoire virtuelle. À la place, ils emploient la segmentation, qui divise les plages d'adresses virtuelles en segments de longueur variable. Une adresse virtuelle se compose d'un numéro de segment et d'un déplacement au sein du segment.

original: We agreed we'd give it a shot.
translated: Nous étions d'accord pour tenter le coup.

original: He ran past without noticing her.
translated: Il courut à côté, sans la remarquer.

original: Manners are like the piano. If they aren't learned early on, they're never learned.
translated: La politesse est comme le piano : si on ne l'apprend pas de bonne heure, on ne l'apprend jamais.

original: Boys tend to look down on their younger sisters.
translated: Les garçons ont tendance à mépriser leurs jeunes sœurs.

original: The soup is very hot.
translated: La soupe est très chaude !

original: What is better than friendship?
translated: Quoi de mieux que l'amitié ?

original: I'd like to eat something.
translated: Je mangerais bien quelque chose.

original: The wedding took place at the Ritz Hotel.
translated: Le mariage a eu lieu à l'hôtel Ritz.

original: He was the sort of man you could get along with.
translated: Il était le genre d'homme avec lequel on pouvait s'entendre.

original: All was quiet except that buses sometimes ran.
translated: Tout était calme, sauf quand parfois des bus passaient.

original: You must be light like a bird and not like a feather.
translated: Il faut être léger comme l'oiseau et non comme la plume.

original: Tom is the owner.
translated: Tom est le propriétaire.
